output_notes.meaning: Critical vulnerability verified by ZAP; immediate attention required.
Potential vulnerability requiring manual verification before reporting.
Database injection vulnerability detected; test with manual payloads.
User input reflected without sanitization; exploit with XSS payload.
Verbose error messages reveal internal details; information disclosure risk.
Session cookies accessible via JavaScript; XSS can steal sessions.
Missing clickjacking protection; application can be framed.

advanced_usage.title: Scripting with ZAP API
advanced_usage.scenario: Automate complex scanning workflows via Python, Java, or JavaScript API clients.
advanced_usage.command:
from zapv2 import ZAPv2
zap = ZAPv2(apikey='changeme', proxies={'http': 'http://127.0.0.1:8080', 'https': 'http://127.0.0.1:8080'})
zap.spider.scan('http://example.com')
notes: Install python-owasp-zap-v2.4 package for Python client.
API supports full ZAP functionality including scan control and reporting.
Use for CI/CD integration, custom workflows, and orchestration.

advanced_usage.title: Custom scan policies and rules
advanced_usage.scenario: Create tailored scan policies for specific application types or compliance requirements.
advanced_usage.command: # Analyze > Scan Policy Manager > Add > Configure thresholds and rules
notes: Adjust attack strength per rule to balance speed and thoroughness.
Disable irrelevant rules to reduce scan time and false positives.
Export policies for reuse across engagements.

advanced_usage.title: Fuzzer for advanced input testing
advanced_usage.scenario: Fuzz specific parameters with custom wordlists and payloads.
advanced_usage.command: # Right-click parameter in Request > Fuzz > Add payloads from file or generator
notes: Supports multiple fuzzers per request for complex testing scenarios.
Processors can encode, hash, or transform payloads before sending.
Results filterable by response code, length, or regex patterns.

advanced_usage.title: Script-based authentication for complex flows
advanced_usage.scenario: Handle multi-step authentication or non-standard login mechanisms.
advanced_usage.command: # Context > Authentication > Script-based > Load or write JavaScript/Zest script
notes: Supports JavaScript and Zest scripting languages.
Scripts can handle OAuth, SAML, multi-factor authentication flows.
Test scripts via manual request before using in automated scans.
